2.36.text:
And with our economy growing and a strong,
majority Government in power, Britain begins

10.07.text:
There are no New Year’s resolutions for
us, just an ongoing resolve to deliver what

15.20.text:
we promised in our manifesto:
Security – at every stage of your life.

21.26.text:
Over 31 million people will begin the year
in work – more than any in our history.

27.66.text:
6 million children will start the new term
at a good or outstanding school.

32.97.text:
More than half a million workers will be taken
out of income tax in April, as everyone apart

39.15.text: from the very best paid gets a tax cut.

41.89.text:
And, for the
lowest paid, there will be a new National

47.03.text:
Meanwhile, millions more will benefit from
the free childcare, new academies, rising

52.97.text:
pensions and extra apprenticeships that we
committed to in our manifesto, all as a result

62.17.text:
We also promised something else in our manifesto:
giving you a say on Europe.

67.11.text: Now we are delivering on that promise.

69.91.text:
There will be an in-out referendum by the
end of 2017 – it is written into the law

77.17.text:
I am negotiating hard to fix the things that
most annoy British people about our relationship

84.20.text:
There is just one thing that drives
me: what is best for the national interest

90.46.text:
But in the end it will be for you to decide:
Is our

93.92.text:
economic and national security in a dangerous
world better protected by being in, or out?

101.28.text:
We also go into the year confronting some
deep social problems, ones that have blighted

109.25.text:
I want 2016 to be the time when we really
start to conquer them - a crucial year in

118.35.text:
Because with economic renewal and social reform,
we can make everyone’s lives more secure.

125.59.text:
So if you’re one of the many hardworking
young people locked out

129.73.text:
of the housing market, we will deliver
the homes that will help lead you to your

136.78.text:
If you’re off school or out of work, trapped
in an underworld of addiction, abuse, crime

141.76.text:
and chaos, we will sweep away state failure
and help give you stability.

147.95.text:
If your dreams
have been dashed simply because of who you

150.56.text:
are, we will fight discrimination and deliver
real opportunity, to

155.40.text: help lay your path to success.

159.26.text:
And we will take on another social problem,
too.

163.06.text:
When our national security is threatened by
a seething hatred of the West, one that turns

168.68.text:
people against
their country and can even turn them into

174.19.text:
I want us to be very clear: You will not defeat
us.

180.45.text:
And we will not just confront the violence
and the terror.

184.03.text:
We will take on their underlying, poisonous
narrative of grievance and resentment.

189.04.text:
We will come down hard on those who create
the conditions for that narrative to

194.99.text:
And we will have greater confidence in – indeed,
we will revel in – our way of life.

201.24.text:
Because if you walk our streets, learn in
our schools, benefit from our society, you

206.18.text:
sign up to
our values: Freedom.

212.98.text:
These are the big challenges of our age, some
of the biggest our nation has ever faced.

218.00.text: And this year is a test of our mettle.

220.99.text:
Whether we put up with poverty – or
put an end to it.

224.41.text: Ignore the glass ceiling – or smash it.

227.33.text:
Abandon the tenant – or help make them a
homeowner.

230.71.text:
Appease the extremist – or take apart their
ideology, piece by piece.

236.39.text:
We’ll get Britain a better deal in Europe,
give families the peace of mind they crave,

242.26.text:
and we’ll make
our country even more secure.

245.17.text:
That’s what this year – this turnaround
decade – is all about.

250.55.text:
So let me wish everyone the very best, and
a very Happy New Year.
